details.title: Heavy traffic outside Mumbai vegetable market
details.content:

details.title: News from Colombo
details.content:
Operation #SamudraSetu: INS Jalashwa arrived in Colombo, Sri Lanka today to bring back Indian citizens stranded overseas. The ship is expected to embark approximately 700 Indian nationals. Earlier, INS Jalashwa had repatriated 1286 citizens from Male, Maldives. pic.twitter.com/265dB8hyoj

details.title: PM seeks advancement of telemedicine, make in India initiatives in healthcare sector
details.content:
PM @narendramodi seeks for an advancement of telemedicine, make in India initiatives in healthcare sector at inaugural of 25th foundation day of Rajiv Gandhi University of Health Sciences , Bengaluru@NewIndianXpress @XpressBengaluru @drashwathcn @mla_sudhakar pic.twitter.com/Cf33ldM7q7

— Pearl Dsouza (@pearl_tnie) June 1, 2020

details.title: PM Modi inaugurates the Silver Jubilee celebrations of Rajiv Gandhi University of Health Sciences, Karnataka. Here is what he said
details.content:
• I want to state it clearly- violence, abuse and rude behaviour against front-line workers is not acceptable.
  • The country has seen rapid progress in setting up 22 more AIIMS.
  • Over the last five years, we have been able to add over 30,000 seats in MBBS and 15,000 seats in post-graduation.
  • Ayushman Bharat- the world’s largest healthcare scheme belongs to India. In less than two years, one crore people have benefitted from this scheme.Women and those staying in villages are among the major beneficiaries of this scheme.
  • 25 years mean Rajiv Gandhi University of Health Sciences is in the prime of its youth.
  • This is the age to think even bigger and do even better. I am confident that the University will continue to scale new heights of excellence in the times to come.
  • The virus may be an invisible enemy. But our warriors, medical workers are invincible. In the battle of Invisible vs Invincible, our medical workers are sure to win.
  • Had it not been for global pandemic, I would've loved to be with you all in Bengaluru to mark this day. At such a time, world is looking up to our doctors, nurses, medical staff & scientific community with hope and gratitude. The world seeks both ‘care’ and ‘cure’ from you.

details.title: Jharkhand CM on migrant workers' crisis
details.content: We've made sincere efforts to bring back our migrant workers from inaccessible remote places like Ladakh and Andamans. We still have hundreds of workers stranded in such remote places. My humble appeal to industries/corporate houses to support us in evacuating our workers: Jharkhand CM

details.title: Delhi border to remain sealed for a week, spas to remain closed: Kejriwal
details.content:
• We are sealing Delhi borders for one week, only essential services will be allowed.
  • We were following odd-even rule for shops in markets but the central government has not stated any such rule, so all shops can open now.
  • Apart from whatever was allowed till now, barbershops and salons will be opened but spas will remain closed.

details.title: Odisha on lockdown extension
details.content:
• Schools and colleges in Odisha to remain closed till July 31, 2020.
  • Public will not be allowed into any place of worship or religious institutions till June 30: Chief Secretary Asit Tripathy 
  • Shopping complexes and malls will remain closed till June 30 while hotels will be allowed to open with 30 percent capacity.
  • CS Asit Tripathy announces shutdown on Saturday & Sunday every week in 11 coastal districts including Ganjam, Puri, Khurda, Jajpur, Bhadrak, Kendrapara, Balasore, Cuttack.
  • Complete shutdown on Saturdays & Sundays in 11 districts till June 30 - Ganjam, Puri, Nayagarh, Khurda, Cuttack, Jagatsinghpur, Kendrapara, Jajpur, Bhadrak, Balasore & Bolangir.
  • Night curfew to continue in Odisha from 7pm to 7 am

Delhi MP @ManojTiwariMP was detained by police during a protest against CM Arvind Kejriwal at Rajghat.
Express photos | @anilpjournalist.#COVID19 @TheMornStandard pic.twitter.com/aimHQv26DR

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) June 1, 2020

details.title: Peon at Puducherry legislative assembly complex contracts COVID-19, CM's office disinfected
details.content:
The peon designated as a multi task worker had come in direct contact with two persons in the office which has 15 employees. He last attended office on May 26 after which he was quarantined since he had attended a function of a pregnant woman in JIPMER who tested positive for COVID-19.  

FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: COVID-19 tally in UP breaches 8000 mark, 27 per cent of cases are migrants who returned
details.content:
Around 30 lakh migrants have thronged Uttar Pradesh from March 1 till date. Not only are they being subjected to strict medical scanning for the coronavirus, but are also being sent to quarantine facilities or home quarantine for 21 days depending on their condition.

FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: Two more die of COVID-19 in Andhra as cases shoot up to 3676 with 105 new patients
details.content: According to the media bulletin issued by the Andhra Pradesh Command Control Room on Monday morning, 10,567 samples in the state were tested in the last 24 hours and 76 tested positive. One more foreign returnee tested positive and another 28 positive cases were reported among those who returned from other states, taking the total number of new cases reported in the last 24 hours to 105.

details.title: ‘Singapore Syndrome’ in India's dormitories causing spurt of COVID-19 cases: Rights body
details.content: In its report “COVID-19 Lockdown: The impact of Singapore Syndrome in India’s dormitories”, the Rights and Risks Analysis Group (RRAG) claimed the lockdown had failed to contain community transmission of infections as reflected in 564 confirmed cases with 10 deaths on March 24 to 1,82,142 confirmed cases with 5,164 deaths as on May 31.

details.title: ‘Singapore Syndrome’ in India's dormitories causing spurt of COVID-19 cases: Rights body
details.content: In its report “COVID-19 Lockdown: The impact of Singapore Syndrome in India’s dormitories”, the Rights and Risks Analysis Group (RRAG) claimed the lockdown had failed to contain community transmission of infections as reflected in 564 confirmed cases with 10 deaths on March 24 to 1,82,142 confirmed cases with 5,164 deaths as on May 31.

details.title: Kerala govt wins plaudits for running 70-seater boat to ferry lone girl to exam hall and back
details.content:
The department operated a passenger boat with five crew members from MN Block, a reclaimed waterlogged island village of Kuttanad, to Kottayam where Sandra Sabu's school is situated. Sandra is a plus two student of SNDP Higher Secondary School Kanjiram in Kottayam. The SWTD operated the 70-seater boat just for the girl to reach the exam centre on two days -- May 29 and 30.

FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: Keep middle seat vacant, or provide protective equipment to occupant, DGCA tells airlies
details.content:
• Airlines shall allot seats in a manner that the middle seat is kept vacant if passenger load and seat capacity permits, if not then middle seat passenger must be provided protective equipment.
  • Directorate General of Civil Aviation directions to come into effect from June 3. Airlines asked to provide all passengers with safety kits, which includes three-layered surgical mask, face shield and adequate sanitizer (sachets/bottle). 

FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: Union Ministers Prakash Javadekar, Nitin Gadkari and Narendra Tomar address the media in Delhi on Union Cabinet's decisions
details.content:

  • Cabinet approves MSP for 14 kharif crops; farmers to get 50-83 pc more than cost.
  • Key steps taken by the government to boost MSMEs; Rs 20,000 crores infusion into the sector

details.title: After Paramilitary, MHA withdraws order of delisting products from police canteens
details.content: MHA has withdrawn the order of de-listing products from Police canteens which was issued on 29th May, revised order with updated list of products will be released soon: Sources

details.title: Chennai doctor back on COVID-19 duty after winning fight against virus
details.content: Appointed as the nodal officer for COVID-19 treatment at Stanley Hospital in January, Dr Ravi has treated hundreds of patients and has been part of all the official meetings in the hospital. But he didn't know at the time that he would contract the virus and turn into a patient himself. “I had a high fever some 15 days ago but got well the next day. But again, I got fatigue and a dry cough, which is when I decided to take a test,’’ he told reporters at a press conference at the hospital on Monday.

details.title: Lockdown: Working women complain of 'online' sexual harassment, say experts
details.content:
The coronavirus-triggered lockdown has posed a lot of challenges for many women professionals who have been working from home for such a long period of time and struggling to manage the work-life balance. Many women had approached the experts for guidance as they were unsure of how to raise complaints of sexual harassment while working from home.

FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: Lessons on loudspeakers for Jharkhand students with no access to virtual classes
details.content:
According to Principal of Upgraded Middle School Ekdary in Dumka, Nirmal Kumar Singh, they have been asked to organize online classes, but it was discovered that more than 70 per cent children did not have access to smartphones. Therefore, after discussion with colleagues in the school, it was decided to organize open-air classes maintaining social distancing.

details.title: Railways' first isolation coaches deployed for treatment of coronavirus patients in Delhi
details.content:
These coaches have been stationed at the maintenance depot of the Shakur Basti railway station in New Delhi. In addition to the 10 non-AC coaches with 160 beds, the COVID-19 care centre will have an AC coach for healthcare staffers, including doctors, an official said.

details.title: AirAsia India offers 50,000 seats without base fare to doctors out of respect
details.content: Under the RedPass initiative, AirAsia India will give away 50,000 seats without any base fare on flights across its domestic sectors to doctors as a gesture of gratitude for their commendable efforts in support of the nation, the airline said in release.

details.title: Here is detailed list of restricted, permitted activities for Delhiites as per 'Unlock 1'
details.content:
As 'Unlock 1' comes into effect from Monday to contain COVID-19 spread, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday announced a detailed set of restrictions and relaxations in the national capital. Addressing a press conference, Chief Minister Kejriwal said the borders of the national capital have been sealed for the next one week and only essential services will be allowed amid the surge in COVID-19 positive cases.

FULL REPORT HERE

However, as it turns out, most eateries were highly dependent on migrant workers and are now desperately seeking alternative options.

details.title: Andhra extends coronavirus lockdown till June 30
details.content: Andhra Pradesh extends coronavirus lockdown till June 30. The state government has issued order to all districts' officials to take effective measures to contain the spread of COVID-19.

details.title: With 70000 cases, Maharashtra remains most affected state
details.content: In Maharashtra, total cases of COVID-19 rose to 70,013 after 2361 persons tested positive on Monday. The state has so far recorded 2362 deaths while 30,108 persons have recovered. The COVID 19 positive patients' recovery rate in the state is 42 per cent while 3.37 per cent mortality rate. The 5.67 lakh people are home quarantined while 36,189 institutional quarantine.

details.title: All tourists centres in Puducherry permitted to reopen
details.content: Briefing newspersons, Arun said that beach Road, botanical gardens, paradise beach, Chunambar boat club and places can open. Shops are now permitted upto 8 p.m, while take away from restaurants upto 9 p.m. Retail liquor shops have been permitted upto 7 pm as in vogue, while bars have not been permitted to open. (READ MORE)

details.title: Tamil Nadu sends back nearly 3 lakh migrants by trains, 1 lakh more await travel home
details.content: The officer, who is involved in regulating the movement of stranded people, said that 7 lakh migrant workers had registered for e-pass. “After removing duplicates, the number became 5 lakh, of which only 4 lakh wanted to go,” he said. He was of the view that the remaining migrants could be sent home by trains -- or buses if needed -- over the coming week. (READ MORE)

details.title: Six districts bordering Delhi record 74 per cent COVID-19 cases in Haryana
details.content: In the last two weeks during lockdown 4.0, there had been a steep rise in the coronavirus cases in the state. There were 223 cases till April 17 and by May 17 the number increased to 910. (READ MORE)

details.title: Language barrier turns nightmare for migrants stuck in Chennai
details.content: They have been shuttling back and forth from Nehru stadium on the adjacent Sydenhams road and the entrance to the railway station from 6pm, stymied by a language barrier. Among the group are four who walked here from Thandalam and want to go to Odisha. The other 37 have staked the last of their money on a bus from Puducherry to Chennai after waiting for two months without pay at their workplaces. They have no resources but for their mobile phones, some food and water. (READ MORE)

details.title: TV star Mohena Kumari Singh, five family members test COVID-19 positive
details.content: Mohena's father-in-law Satpal Maharaj, who is Uttarakhand's tourism minister, tested positive for coronavirus on Sunday.

details.title: Kejriwal addreeses Delhi residents. Here is what he said
details.content:
• Number of cases in Delhi are increasing, but there's no need to worry about medical care for COVID-19 patients as we have done sufficient arrangements. If any member of your family tests positive, then they will get the required medical services.
  • We are four steps ahead of coronavirus. Cases are increasing in Delhi but we have made all the arrangements for beds, ICUs and ventilators.
  • However, there have been instances where people are complaining of shortage of beds and medical facilities, so clearly there is gap in information as even today around 4100 beds are still vacant.
  • To avoid this kind of situation in future, we are launching an app today. It will provide you information about all the hospitals in Delhi, private as well as government.
  • It will tell you the number of vacant beds in every hospital. Total 302 ventilators are available in Delhi, of which 210 are vacant.
  • All this information will be updated on this app twice a day, 10 am and 6 pm, to give you latest details.

details.title: 119 migrants, who returned to UP, test positive for coronavirus
details.content: 119 out of 450 samples of migrant labourers whose results we received, have tested positive for Coronavirus. We are tracking migrant labourers returning to the state with the help of ASHA workers. 11,68,917 labourers have been tracked till now, out of which 1,036 are symptomatic. Their samples have been collected for test: State Principal Secretary (Health), Amit Mohan Prasad

details.title: Health Ministry briefing on COVID19 situation in India
details.content:
• Till now, 95,527 COVID19 patients have recovered. The recovery rate is now 48.07%.
  • 73% of COVID19 deaths in India are people with co-morbidities.
  • 10% of India's population accounts for 50% of India's COVID19 linked deaths.
  • The fatality rate in our country is 2.82%, one of the lowest in the world.
  • We have asked all states to analyse the trajectory of the cases in their respective states. If a state thinks that it needs to set up temporary COVID19 care centres then it must do so.

details.title: ICMR briefing on COVID19 situation in India
details.content:
• We have 681 laboratories that are approved for conducting COVID-19 tests- 476 in Government sector and 205 in private sector, as of 1st June 2020. Today, we are conducting 1 lakh 20 thousand tests every day: Nivedita Gupta, Scientist at Indian Council of Medical Research
  • Indian RNA extraction kits are now available in good number, RT-PCR kits by 11-12 indigenous vendors are now being used, we are now in a comfortable position as reg. testing, due to identification and hand-holding of domestic players.
  • We've been using indigenous platforms too for ramping up COVID-19 testing capacity. Truenat screening&confirmatory tests have now been validated. Outreach of testing has hence been increased since this is available in primary health centres and districts
  • Instead of the use of the word 'community transmission', we need to understand the extent of the spread of the disease. We are far from the peak.Our measures to curtail the disease are effective. India has been very good in the reduction in mortality:Nivedita Gupta, ICMR

details.title: Here's an app for one-stop solution to healthcare services in Assam, Tripura
details.content: “Quickobook”, the health tech startup, has already connected 2.3 lakh patients in Assam’s Barak Valley and Tripura with doctors. The man who came out with this technological solution is Biswajit Paul. The 28-year-old from Silchar in Barak Valley claimed it is India’s only software, which can live-track the status of appointment with doctors.

Bihar govt distributing condoms, contraceptive pills to migrant workers post-quarantine
details.content: Bihar government along with the NGO has been distributing condoms and contraceptive pills amongst the migrant workers when they leave for their homes after undergoing the mandatory 14-day quarantine period. The ASHA workers have been deployed for distributing contraceptive pills amongst women. The condoms are being distributed amongst men by the NGO's Family Planning Coordinators and Block-level executives

details.title: CBSE releases notification for the conduct of class 10th, 12th exams
details.content:
Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has released notification for the conduct of class 10th (only for northeast district of Delhi) and class 12th (All India) examinations that are scheduled to be held from 1st July to 15th July 2020. pic.twitter.com/pIT4qPZCi8

— ANI (@ANI) June 2, 2020

details.title: AAI office in Delhi sealed after official tests positive
details.content: Airports Authority of India (AAI) office in Rajeev Gandhi Bhawan has been sealed till 4th June after four AAI officials test positive for COVID19.

details.title: SC seeks consent of advocates for physically appearing in court
details.content: Supreme Court notifies all advocates and party-in-person to give their joint consent with regard to willingness for physically appearing and arguing in the court. On receipt of the consent of all the parties, the matter will be considered for listing.

details.title: With few passengers even in lockdown 5.0, cab drivers explore other ways to make ends meet
details.content: S Dhanapaul from Korukkupet, who drives a cab for an online ridesharing company, is one of the many drivers who had to look for another job during the lockdown. "After many people driving trucks and minivans left to their hometowns, there was a need to deliver goods to stores and carry loads from vegetable and fish markets. So I borrowed a minivan from my friend who had gone home and delivered goods to grocery stores from godowns. It was just enough to make a living for 40 days," he said. (READ MORE)

details.title: Maharashtra tally at 72300
details.content:
In Maharashtra, total 72,300 #Covid19 positive patients while 2465 deaths & 31,333 patients got recover & discharged. Today, 2287 new patients, 103 deaths & 1225 cured & discharge reported.@NewIndianXpress @Sunday_Standard

— Sudhir Suryawanshi (@ss_suryawanshi) June 2, 2020

details.title: PM Modi holds telephone conversation with Trump over COVID
details.content: PM Narendra Modi had a telephone conversation today with US Pres Donald Trump. Pres Trump extended an invitation to PM Modi to attend the next G-7 Summit to be held in USA: Prime Minister's Office

details.title: The Quarantino memes are becoming a reality
details.content: A baby boy born to a couple placed under institutional quarantine in Manipur's Kangpokpi district after returning from Goa has been named Emmanuel Quarantino, officials said on Tuesday. Quarantino is the first baby born at a quarantine centre in the northeastern state, they added. (READ MORE)

details.title: 50-year-old Tripura woman kills self over fear of COVID-19
details.content: The woman, who hailed from West Tripura district, was admitted to the hospital on Monday as she had complained of fever and breathlessness. Soon, her swab sample was collected, the report of which was awaited.

details.title: Delhi tally crosses 22000 after massive spike in cases
details.content: Delhi records 1,298 fresh coronavirus cases, highest single-day spike takes tally to over 22K; death toll mounts to 556: Authorities.

details.title: Community transmission began in Mumbai before lockdown was imposed: Study
details.content:
A spatial analysis of trends by a researcher from the Tata Institute of Social Science has revealed that the SARS-CoV-2 had spread across the community in Mumbai before the lockdown started but the cases started getting detected later with increased testing. 

Mumbai, which had 34,018 confirmed cases and 1,097 infection-related deaths by Tuesday morning, saw over 375 times increase of cases within 50 days of the lockdown. (READ MORE)
